column5: Well after seeing what a great fishery was only an hour away I decided to take a trip down to Dunville and see what the shore fishery was all about. After spenindg sevral hours this week hitting different web site and distilling down all the info I felt prepared to tangle wioth a few cats.  Malcolm, my son and I pulled into Fishmaster's place about 8am and got what appeared to be a primo spot right close to the marina opening. I went down with my 9ft steelhead spinning rods, 14lb test main line and a selection of 1-3 oz weights, 4/0 circle hooks.  We fished all day trying worms, frozen sardines and finally cut bait sucker from Fishmaster and managed 1 fish, a small 4 lber but I took away a world of learning.  most all of the shoreline in front of Fishamaters is sand/gravel - 14lb is way too much line most important thing when fishing form shore is to get the longest cast possible. 2 groups hit fish all day and they out distanced all shoreline anglers on the cast.  When I head back down I will be rigged with my 10.5", 10 lb braid and 3/4 oz egg sinkers. I know I can chuck those way farther than the rig I had today. Oh yeah the 2 groups that hit fish used strictly sucker meat. The fish I got also came on sucker meat.    May post pictures tomorrow of how Saturday lunch went. Good seeing ya Goran. Sorry didn't recognize you when you first went by in the boat. Not used to seeing 2 guys that big in 1 boat.
Nice fish.  T'was a learning experience for me as well.
WTG , i learned alot out there today as well first time for me out there
Houston.. we have a catfish!  Great stuff Paul !
Great report and pic Fang  Good job!!  Beauty cat Thanks for sharing Leechman
Right on! Go Team 8!!  Fishing is all about learning. The day you don't learn anything, its time to pack 'er in.  I went perchin today and learned a ton too!!  Sinker

Fang so that was you over there myself and Curt where at the other end in the white trailblazer. We had a fire going as well. It was a nice day and we did see the guys your talking about land lots of cats. Will try to head out again this sunday.
Glad your learning,,,i find it fun to get out there for cats while i wait for the other species to come into season and a great fight!!
Good job. I'm hoping to head down again on Monday. Hopefully I'll catch my first cat.
Fang trust me... the extra 600+lbs that was added to my boat certainly was noticeable!!  Nice to have met you..  G..

Dont worry Fang happened to me too. Went there last year and casted to sides all morning long, few locals stoped by and started casting straight out as far as they can and started hitting fish after fish. But thats how you learn
Good seeing you again paul... can't wait to get out for our rubber lipped friends...
